Module me.t8d.capstone.frontend
Package me.t8d.capstone.frontend.controller

Class MainFormController

java.lang.Object
me.t8d.capstone.frontend.controller.MainFormController
public class MainFormController extends Object
Controller for the main window of this application. This allows the user to view and manage an inventory of parts and products.
Author:
Thomas Miller

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    MainFormController()
    Default constructor for the MainFormController.
    MainFormController(Inventory inventory)
    Constructor for the MainFormController, which takes an Inventory object.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    addPart(Part part)
    Interface function for subclasses to call, to add parts into the inventory.
    void
    addProduct(Product product)
    Interface function for subclasses to call, to add products into the inventory.
    int
    getNextPartID()
    When a new part is created, this finds the next available ID to use for this part.
    int
    getNextProductID()
    When a new product is created, this finds the next available ID to use for this product.
    void
    initialize()
    Initializes this controller/window by creating an Inventory, connecting the inventory's parts/products to the tables within the window, initializing the search bars, and adding some test data to pre-fill the inventory.
    void
    replacePart(Part part, int index)
    Interface function for subclasses to call, replace/update a part within the inventory.
    void
    replaceProduct(Product product, int index)
    Interface function for subclasses to call, replace/update a product within the inventory.
    void
    setWindowDisabled()
    Interface function for subclasses to call, to disable user interaction with the main window.
    void
    setWindowEnabled()
    Interface function for subclasses to call, to enable user interaction with the main window.

  • Constructor Details

    • MainFormController

      public MainFormController(Inventory inventory)
      Constructor for the MainFormController, which takes an Inventory object. This is only for unit testing purposes.
      Parameters:
      inventory - for the inventory to be used for this window.

    • MainFormController

      public MainFormController()
      Default constructor for the MainFormController.

  • Method Details

    • addPart

      public void addPart(Part part)
      Interface function for subclasses to call, to add parts into the inventory.
      Parameters:
      part - for the newly created part

    • replacePart

      public void replacePart(Part part, int index)
      Interface function for subclasses to call, replace/update a part within the inventory.
      Parameters:
      part - for the newly created/modified part
      index - for the old part's index within the inventory

    • replaceProduct

      public void replaceProduct(Product product, int index)
      Interface function for subclasses to call, replace/update a product within the inventory.
      Parameters:
      product - for the newly created/modified product
      index - for the old product's index within the inventory

    • getNextPartID

      public int getNextPartID()
      When a new part is created, this finds the next available ID to use for this part.
      Returns:
      the next available ID to be used for a new part.

    • getNextProductID

      public int getNextProductID()
      When a new product is created, this finds the next available ID to use for this product.
      Returns:
      the next available ID to be used for a new product.

    • addProduct

      public void addProduct(Product product)
      Interface function for subclasses to call, to add products into the inventory.
      Parameters:
      product - for the newly created product

    • setWindowEnabled

      public void setWindowEnabled()
      Interface function for subclasses to call, to enable user interaction with the main window.

    • setWindowDisabled

      public void setWindowDisabled()
      Interface function for subclasses to call, to disable user interaction with the main window.

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes this controller/window by creating an Inventory, connecting the inventory's parts/products to the tables within the window, initializing the search bars, and adding some test data to pre-fill the inventory.
